name: Kepler-252
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-252 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-252 is a star with 0.4499999999999998 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.55 times its radius. It is located 1251.10 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-252 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-252 b

Kepler-252 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.67 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-252.

The mass of Kepler-252 b is 1.59 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-252 b is 1.23 that of Earth. At 1.59 Earth masses, Kepler-252 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-252 c

Kepler-252 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.85 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-252.

The mass of Kepler-252 c is 6.05 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-252 c is 2.15 that of Earth. At 6.05 Earth masses, Kepler-252 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-252, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
